labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement

body:
Now that we have changed the chevrons (the little > icon) of the workspace editor and expenses/reports, it's time to bring the consistency over to push inputs and option rows For all pushrows and options rows: Spec: Notes: - Icon goes from 20px -> 16px - Icon goes from 100% opacity to 50% opacity - Icon should be 100% opacity on hover - We wanna make sure we do a test build of this before we merge it into the product - All other layout should stay the same cc @Expensify/design @Expensify/product-pr

If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.65-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2203/folder/13176904 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** forexmater+781781@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 10/Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Preconditions: User is logged in; Netsuite connected 1. Open https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Click "Workspaces" tab 3. Open the Workspace with Netsuite connected 4. Click "Accounting" > "Export" 5. Click "Invoice Item" ("Select existing"/"Expensify Invoice Line Item" is selected and integration is synced) 6. Click "Invoice Item" field 7. Click on "Expensify invoice expense" 8. Click outside to close RHP 9. Click "Export" > "Invoice Item" > "Invoice Item" field 10. Click "Expensify Invoice Line Item" ## Expected Result: After close the RHP and select "Expensify Invoice Line Item", should be navigated back to "Invoice item" on the RHP. ## Actual Result: After close the RHP and select "Expensify Invoice Line Item", the RHP is closed. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eb520800-0f63-42d9-81b1-4e8eb32b6990 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** N/A **Reproducible in staging?:** Not yet tested **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** N/A **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/569088 **Issue reported by:** Customers in the linked issue, and @johncschuster **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03SSAQ7P/p1763763948408779 ## Action Performed: 1. User opens a report in New Expensify (Web) 2. Clicks the option to export the report as a PDF 3. A popup appears and spins as if loading 4. After several seconds, the popup closes and the user is returned to the report screen ## Expected Result: The report should be successfully exported as a PDF and downloaded to the user‚Äôs device. ## Actual Result: The download fails silently: - No PDF is generated or downloaded - No error message is shown - In some cases, the downloaded PDF is blank - Issue is observed more frequently with larger reports (e.g., 90+ expenses or high receipt count) but also occurs on smaller reports ## Workaround: Yes, a workaround exists. Users have reported successful PDF downloads using Safari when Chrome fails. The Concierge team has communicated this workaround to affected users. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

body:
If you haven‚Äôt already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.64-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75113 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdoinjsoidjsoijsiodjo@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 26.1 / Chrome **App Component:** Search ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create two expenses. 4. Go to Reports > Reports. 5. Select the report from Step 3 via checkbox. ‚Üí Dropdown button shows "1 selected". 6. Resize the screen to small (or do Step 1 to 5 on Android or iOS app). ‚Üí Dropdown button shows "2 selected". ## Expected Result: When selecting a report with multiple expenses, dropdown button will show the same amount on wide and small screen. ## Actual Result: When selecting a report with multiple expenses, dropdown button shows different amount on wide and small screen. In Step 5, on wide screen, dropdown button shows the number of report selected - 1 selected. In Step 6, on small screen (or Android and iOS), dropdown button shows the number of expenses selected - 2 selected. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a94bfc95-282a-4210-a367-694392cf5362 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
